title: Financial Controller
description:
* Company: BluEdge
* Hourly Rate: Openbid
* Location: Stockholm (SE)
* Start Date: 16 Jan 2025
* Renewable End Date: 12 Sep 2025


 We are looking for an experienced and motivated
 **Financial Controller** 
 to join our team in Stockholm. In this role, you will be responsible for the consolidation and reporting of financial figures to group accounting in Norway. You will establish and manage processes between the client and the Shared Service Center, ensuring efficient handover of data. Additionally, you will contribute to other financial control projects during non-financial statement periods.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Perform consolidation of financial figures and report to group accounting in Norway.
* Establish and manage processes between the client and the Shared Service Center.
* Handle and analyze large amounts of financial data efficiently and accurately.
* Ensure compliance with Swedish accounting regulations (K3) and International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).
* Drive change initiatives and process development within financial control.
* Collaborate with various stakeholders across finance, outsourcing partners, and other group companies.
* Work independently and deliver high-quality results while meeting strict deadlines.


**Requirements**
* Extensive experience in consolidated accounting.
* Several years of work experience with a strong emphasis on qualified accounting.
* Proven knowledge of Swedish accounting regulations (K3) and IFRS.
* Experience working in larger companies with complex operations and system environments.
* Familiarity with shared service centers and their operations.
* Advanced proficiency in Excel, with the ability to manage and analyze large datasets.
* Strong analytical abilities with a keen eye for detail.
* Proven ability to meet deadlines and manage competing priorities.
* Demonstrated experience driving change and developing processes within financial control.


**Desirable Skills:**
* Experience with Oracle EPM Cloud/FCC.
* Exceptional communication and social skills, with the ability to build relationships across multiple contact areas.
* Solution-oriented and proactive in driving improvements.
* Structured and detail-oriented with the ability to see the broader financial picture.


**Personal Attributes:**
* A team player who thrives on collaboration.
* Self-motivated and capable of working independently in a structured and accurate manner.
* Committed to delivering high-quality work and continuous improvement.

title: Senior Cloud Data Engineer | SEB, Solna
description:
Are you a cloud data engineer eager to turn data and innovation into real value? Do you thrive on delivering high-quality solutions, exploring new technologies, and continuously improving? If you have experience with financial products and a passion for creating impactful solutions, this could be the perfect role for you!
   

  

 At SEB, we’re on an exciting journey of transformation. As one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics, we blend our proud heritage with entrepreneurial innovation. Join us in our growing data division and make your mark on the future of trading technology.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a
 **Cloud Data Engineer** 
 , you’ll play a key role in shaping our regulatory and trading technology landscape. Collaborating within a cross-functional team, you’ll engage in the full development lifecycle—from gathering requirements to deployment and stakeholder collaboration. In this position, you will:
   

  

* Design, develop, and maintain a cutting-edge data warehouse on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) .
* Build and optimize efficient data pipelines that seamlessly integrate with trading systems.
* Partner with stakeholders to deliver business-critical data solutions with agility and precision.
* Elevate the team’s expertise through code reviews, coaching, and active participation in technical decisions.
* Contribute to knowledge sharing through pair-programming, mob-programming, demos, and discussions.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have**
 We’re seeking a curious and driven individual with a strong technical background and a passion for creating value through data. You should have:
   

  

* Expertise in data integration, data modeling, and building data pipelines in the cloud.
* Proficiency in SQL and programming (preferably Python).
* Experience with version control (Git) and Agile development methodologies.
* A focus on testing and test automation.


**Bonus points if you have**
* Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloud Run, Pub/Sub, Cloud Storage).
* Dataform/dbt, Airflow, Terraform.
* Monitoring and alerting for Data Warehouses.
* Data management or data mesh principles.


 We value team players with a positive mindset who show respect for others and a genuine interest in learning and growth.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Work on exciting projects where your expertise drives tangible results.
* Lead initiatives in building a robust, scalable, and automated testing framework on Google Cloud.
* Be part of a talented, inclusive, and humble team that believes in openness and collaboration.
* Enjoy learning through pair-programming, mob-programming, and engaging demos.
* Experience a culture that values you as an individual while celebrating the power of teamwork.


 At SEB, we’re not just building a data warehouse—we’re creating an inclusive tech space where everyone can innovate and grow. If you’re ready to make an impact, we’d love to welcome you to our team!
   

  

 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Since we review applications and select potential candidates on a continuous basis, you are welcome to send your application as soon as possible, but no later than 6th of January 2025. For questions regarding the position or the recruitment process, please contact Team manager Ali Rezai at ali.rezai@seb.se or Talent Acquisition Partner at karl.saeter@seb.se.
   

  

***Please note that due to the holiday season, it might take us a little longer to get back to you, but we truly appreciate your patience and enthusiasm.***
 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

description:

**Job Title: Oracle NetSuite Finnish** 
**speaking Sales Development Representative, New Business**

**Why Oracle NetSuite**
 Founded in 1998, Oracle NetSuite was the first cloud company – ushering in the new era of cloud computing. NetSuite’s mission is to deliver one system, the suite, that gives leaders a complete view into their business.
   

  

 As the industry leading cloud business system recognised in Gartner’s Magic Quadrants, NetSuite includes financials, inventory management, HR, professional services automation, commerce, and more. Tens of thousands of customers all over the world trust NetSuite to give their businesses the visibility, agility, and control needed to make data-informed decisions quickly.
   

  

 NetSuite is a place where you can build a career and have fun while doing so! We’re invested in our people, our customers, and the community. And as part of Oracle, our benefits are second to none. Joining our passionate team means that you’re ready to take your career to the next level. With priceless learning opportunities, strong support, incredible innovation, and volunteer opportunities, NetSuite is committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels empowered and set up for success.
   

  

  

  

**The Oracle NetSuite Sales Development Representative (SDR) Role**
 The SDR role provides a hands-on experience, sourcing and qualifying leads while building product knowledge and developing fundamental sales skills. We are looking to hire our next superstar sales representative to help us continue to accelerate our YoY growth through revenue generation. Within this role, you will get the best of both worlds – training and autonomy. The SDR role provides an unmissable, hands-on learning opportunity that will allow you to contribute to our ongoing success.
   

  

**Want to know more? Check out these resources.**
* NetSuite Instagram
* Netsuite Website
* Netsuite Customer Testimonials
* Netsuite LinkedIn Page
* Netsuite YouTube Channel


****Your Responsibilities****
* Analyze and understand prospective customer needs, personas, processes, projects and requirements in order to ascertain potential solutions.
* Perform outbound prospecting through cold-calling, emails and social media to generate high quality, BANT qualified leads that can be promoted to sales.
* Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of Oracle Netsuite solutions and our value proposition so that you can speak around value and return on investment vs technical functionalities.
* Maintain a high volume of tailored, strategic, multi-channel outreach for your target accounts.
* Confidently interact with and influence key personnel up to and including Executives at the highest levels of an organization
* Build strong relationships and collaborate effectively with the Account Executives that you support.
* Prioritise your time and accounts effectively to ensure success


****Minimum Qualifications****
* Native level of at least a Nordic language + fluency in English (additional languages advantageous)
* BS/BA degree in Business Management, Finance or Economics

* Adaptable, resilient, self-starter with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and a desire to succeed
* Excellent communication (verbal, written, and presentation) and interpersonal skills

We also encourage our employees to engage in the culture of giving back to the communities where we live and do business.

title: SW Verification & Test Engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Vi söker en erfaren och kunnig mjukvarutestare inom inbyggda system att ansluta sig till vårt team. Som mjukvaruutvecklare är du ansvarig för att designa och utveckla testfall, genomföra manuella o automatiska tester hos en av våra kunder. Du kommer att arbeta nära intressenter för att förstå krav, anpassa funktionallitet och tillhandahålla teknisk support.



Som konsult hos oss är vanliga arbetsuppgifter:


* Samarbeta i teamet hos kunden för att samla funktionskrav för att sedan utveckla testfall.
* Erbjuda teknisk kompetens och support, felsöka problem och optimera prestanda.
* Skapa och upprätthålla teknisk dokumentation.


Områden där våra kunder arbetar:


* Autonoma fordon
* Electromobility (elektrisk drivlina)
* Connectivity (uppkopplade fordon/enheter)

### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* Civilingenjörsexamen i robotik, mekatronik, inbyggda system, datavetenskap, eller relaterat område. Alternativt motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet som mjukvarutestare.
* Stark problemlösningsförmåga och förmåga att arbeta självständigt eller som en del av ett team.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att samarbeta effektivt med kunder och teammedlemmar.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i skrift och tal.
* Ett plus är även certifiering inom ISTQB

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



Hos oss blir du välkomnad av glada och hjälpsamma kollegor. Vi har roligt på jobbet, högt i tak och ett engagerande klimat. Du står aldrig ensam inför en utmaning utan kan bolla idéer och hitta möjligheter tillsammans med dina kollegor. Vi tror på att samarbete är nyckeln till framgång. På Sigma Industry Innovation har du möjlighet att samarbeta med experter från olika teknikområden och utbyta idéer i en stödjande och inkluderande arbetsmiljö. Vi investerar i våra medarbetare och erbjuder kontinuerlig utveckling och utbildning. Här kan du ständigt växa i din karriär och bredda din expertis.



Sigma Industry Innovation är ett entreprenörsdrivet företag med stora visioner och korta beslutsvägar, vilket ger goda möjligheter att påverka såväl din egen som företagets framtid. Vill du bli expert inom ditt befintliga område, växa in i ett nytt eller engagera dig internt på Sigma? Möjligheterna är oändliga och hos oss får du allt i ett: en trygg anställning, en stimulerande vardag och en skräddarsydd framtid. Vi tror på att trivas på jobbet. Hos oss skapar vi en positiv och rolig arbetsmiljö där gemenskap och arbetsglädje är i fokus. Kom och gör skillnad med oss!


### **WE OFFER**



**Tack för att du har läst vår annons!**



Vi hoppas att du känner dig nyfiken på oss och vi ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan och ditt CV. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan **redan i dag.**



Tveka inte och kontakt mig för mera information:



Johan.soderroos@sigma.se



073 - 647 7052



**#LI-Hybrid**



* #### **POSITION**


SW Verification & Test Engineer
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry Innovation
* #### **LOCATION**


Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Electricity & Automation, Energy & Power Engineering, Hardware Electronics, Testing and Verification, Software development embedded systems, RF And Microwave, Function development, System design, System development, Operation, support and infrastructure, Test & Quality, Project Management, Software development, Digitalisation, Digitalisation, Automation
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2024-12-25
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2025-01-31

Johan Söderroos, johan.soderroos@sigma.se, +46736477052

title: Data Engineer
description:
Vill du arbeta i en innovativ miljö där data och teknologi används för att stärka våra kunders konkurrenskraft? Har du erfarenhet som Data Engineer och är redo att bli en del av ett team med expertis i data, teknik och strategi? Då är Bricobomba rätt arbetsplats för dig! Hos oss kommer du få arbeta inom områden såsom data warehouse, datamodellering, molnarkitektur, DevOps och data management. Vi letar nu efter vår nästa kollega som vill stärka upp vårt team.
   

  

 Som Data Engineer hos oss ser vi gärna att du:
   

  

* Har en relevant utbildning.
* Har 5-10 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Har arbetat med SQL och någon modelleringsteknik för relationsdatabaser.
* Arbetat i en molnbaserad miljö: föredragsvis Snowflake, Azure eller Databricks.
* Har kunskap inom minst ett programmeringsspråk. Vi använder oss för tillfället mycket av C# och Python.
* Har flytande kunskaper i svenska.


 För oss är kompetens viktigt, men vi värdesätter även personliga egenskaper, driv och vilja högt. Dessutom tror vi att du kan relatera till våra tre värdeord
 *ödmjukhet* 
 ,
 *pragmatism* 
 och
 *kommunikation* 
 . Vi arbetar ofta i team ute hos våra kunder eftersom vi tror på kraften i samarbete. Vi är övertygade om att det bästa sättet att lära sig något nytt är tillsammans med inspirerande kollegor.
   

  

**Om Bricobomba**
 Namnet Bricobomba kommer från det franska ordet “Bricolage” som ungefär betyder “gör-det-själv”. Denna filosofi genomsyrar vårt arbetssätt. Vi ger våra kunder kunskap och verktyg som de behöver för att kunna ta kontroll och göra saker själva. Vi vill kunna vara en helhetspartner för våra kunder och erbjuder kompetens inom allt från att etablera infrastruktur, bygga systemstöd, utföra dataanalys och etablera dataprocesser.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 En arbetsplats med stora möjligheter till utveckling, lära och läras av sina kollegor. Tillsammans har vi olika aktiviteter och tävlingar under året, stora som små. Vi har även årlig konferens, sommaravslutning och julbord. Vi främjar och uppmuntrar eget initiativ i arbetet såväl som olika aktiviteter som vi kan göra tillsammans.
